item.title: Road surface including previous patch repairs is badly deteriorated, 28th November
item.description:
The majority of the road surface of Harp Hill (in particular outside the Battledown Centre For Children & Families to Greenway Lane) and also Aggs Hill from Mill Lane junction to Birdlip Road junction is in a poor state. The road has been repeatedly patched but really needs resurfacing to bring it back to an acceptable standard especially given the significant volume of traffic that use this route.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle way from Barnet way north towards wall, ice cream crossing a 40/38, 28th November
item.description:
This cycleway is poorly maintained with significant detritus from fallen leaves, and it could do with a clean, not just illustrated way at the beginning of the track by Barnet way, but also further along its route. For example by lump standard for just south of the access onto the Bridgeway Across the dual carriageway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnett Way, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycleway from Barnwood Road to Sainsbury’s Barnwood uneven carriageway, 28th November
item.description:
The cycleway is damaged adjacent to lump standard number seven, due to tree roots growth from adjacent trees. The extent of the damage extends the whole width of the cycle way, and for a distance of about 2 m.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnett Way, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 28th November
item.description:
23/11/23 email rcvd - In the last two weeks or so the regular traffic lights at Sixways, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham are showing green light for a shorter time for main London Road traffic. Causing long tailbacks of inbound and outbound A40 traffic which weren’t there before. Could you check please? Thanks,
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.description:

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 28th November
item.description:
The keep clear space is half the size of the previous one which doesn’t allow any but a very small car to join the A40 from Glenfall Way? This is both silly and disappointing. Fed up local residents.

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 28th November
item.description:
21/11/23 email rcvd, passed from Chelt. BC - Dear Sirs, Over the past two days tree surgeons have been attending to the above street tree. Whilst they have been polite & requested we move vehicles I am disappointed and annoyed at the mess & damage they have made to my property. I have been working at home all morning & it would have been courteous for them to knock the door when they had finished but I guess that they just wanted to get away. I attach some photographs for your information. We have a constant battle in keeping our garden tidy from the debris that falls from this tree, blossom in the spring, apples in the late summer & leaves in the winter. Whilst we accept this chore in compensation of having the tree adjacent to our home, the additional work created by your contractors is unacceptable. Of particular concern is the broken gully gratings & the scarring on the drive from allowing the larger branches to simply drop from the tree. (photos 3 & 4) I’m sure that the latter will erase in time, but I must insist on the replacement of the gully gratings. I look forward to hearing from you Kind Regards
Report on FixMyStreet
